column1: There are example properties files for using the coreference systems in edu/stanford/nlp/coref/properties. The properties are named [system]-[language].properties. For example, to run the deterministic system on Chinese:,java -Xmx5g -cp stanford-corenlp-4.0.0.jar:stanford-chinese-corenlp-models-4.0.0.jar:* edu.stanford.nlp.pipeline.StanfordCoreNLP -props edu/stanford/nlp/coref/properties/deterministic-chinese.properties -file example_file.txt,https://stanfordnlp.github.io/CoreNLP/coref.html

Alternatively, the properties can be set manually. For example, to run the neural system on English:,"java -Xmx5g -cp stanford-corenlp-4.0.0.jar:stanford-corenlp-4.0.0-models.jar:* edu.stanford.nlp.pipeline.StanfordCoreNLP -annotators tokenize,ssplit,pos,lemma,ner,parse,coref -coref.algorithm neural -file example_file.txt",https://stanfordnlp.github.io/CoreNLP/coref.html
The following example shows how to access coref and mention information from an Annotation:,"import java.util.Properties
public static void main(String[] args) throws Exception {
Annotation document = new Annotation(""Barack Obama was born in Hawaii.  He is the president. Obama was elected in 2008."")

To use the English deterministic system, you need to use the dcoref annotator.,"java -Xmx5g edu.stanford.nlp.pipeline.StanfordCoreNLP -annotators tokenize,ssplit,pos,lemma,ner,parse,dcoref -file example.txt",https://stanfordnlp.github.io/CoreNLP/coref.html

If you would like to run our statistical or neural systems on the CoNLL 2012 eval data:,java -Xmx6g -cp stanford-corenlp-4.0.0.jar:stanford-corenlp-4.0.0-models.jar:* edu.stanford.nlp.coref.CorefSystem -props edu/stanford/nlp/coref/properties/neural-english-conll.properties -coref.data  -coref.conllOutputPath  -coref.scorer,https://stanfordnlp.github.io/CoreNLP/coref.html
